prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. The euler angles are 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0, and the translation vector is 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Next, create a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch contains one face (face\\_1) and one loop (loop\\_1). loop\\_1 consists of four lines: * line\\_1: Start Point = 0.0, 0.0, End Point = 0.75, 0.0 * line\\_2: Start Point = 0.75, 0.0, End Point = 0.75, 0.0938 * line\\_3: Start Point = 0.75, 0.0938, End Point = 0.0, 0.0938 * line\\_4: Start Point = 0.0, 0.0938, End Point = 0.0, 0.0 After creating the 2D sketch, scale it using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles from the coordinate system and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrusion depth towards the normal is 0.0469, the extrusion depth opposite the normal is 0.0, the sketch scale is 0.75, and the operation is to create a new solid body. The final dimensions of part 1 are 0.75 units in length, 0.75 units in width, and 0.0469 units in height. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 2. The euler angles are 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0, and the translation vector is 0.4727, 0.0195, 0.0469. Next, create a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch contains one face (face\\_1) and one loop (loop\\_1). loop\\_1 consists of one circle: * circle\\_1: Center = 0.0273, 0.0273, Radius = 0.0273 After creating the 2D sketch, scale it using a scaling parameter of 0.0547. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles from the coordinate system and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrusion depth towards the normal is 0.0, the extrusion depth opposite the normal is 0.0313, the sketch scale is 0.0547, and the operation is to cut or remove material. The final dimensions of part 2 are 0.0547 units in length, 0.0547 units in width, and 0.0312 units in height. The overall dimensions of the final shape are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The curved side has a radius of 0.5 units.</description>

Constrain the circle as necessary to ensure it is centered and closed. 5. Create a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation and a translation of (0.2978, 0, 0). 6. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.1715 units, creating the second part. Final CAD Model Combine the parts using a boolean operation to join them into a single solid body. The final shape should be a cylindrical object with a rectangular prism attached to its side. - "A CAD model of a cylindrical object with a rectangular prism attached to its side." - The length of the rectangular prism is approximately 0.75 units. - The width of the rectangular prism is approximately 0.75 units. - The height of the rectangular prism is approximately 0.0586 units. - The diameter of the cylindrical object is approximately 0.3 units. - The height of the cylindrical object is approximately 0.1715 units. The inner rectangular hole in the cylinder is equal in size to the rectangular prism, making the overall shape appear as if a rectangular prism was attached to the side of a cylinder.</description>
